com.analog.lyric.dimple.factorfunctions.core

Class FactorFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.analog.lyric.dimple.factorfunctions.core.FactorFunction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IFactorFunction
    Direct Known Subclasses:

      • evalEnergy

        public abstract double evalEnergy(Value[] values)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorFunction
        Evaluates the possibly unnormalized negative log probability density of the arguments.

        This must be equivalent to -log(IFactorFunction.eval(com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values.Value[])(values)).

        Specified by:

        Description copied from interface: IFactorFunction

        This must be equivalent to exp(-IFactorFunction.evalEnergy(com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values.Value[])(values)).

      • getDirectedToIndicesForInput

        @Nullable
public int[] getDirectedToIndicesForInput(Factor factor,
                                          int inputEdge)
        Returns the output indices that can be changed when specified input is changed or else null if the same as the full set of output edges.

        The default implementation returns null.

        This may be overridden for functions that have multiple outputs and inputs for which a single input may only affect a subset of the full outputs (e.g. MatrixProduct).

        Since:
        0.05

      • isDeterministicDirected

        public boolean isDeterministicDirected()
        Specified by:
        isDeterministicDirected in interface IFactorFunction
        Returns:
        true if function is deterministic ( i.e. IFactorFunction.eval(com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values.Value[]) always returns either 0 or 1 for all arguments and IFactorFunction.evalEnergy(com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values.Value[]) returns either zero or infinity) and directed.

        Specified by:
        isDirected in interface IFactorFunction
        Returns:
        true if function is inherently directed such that some of its arguments can be considered to be "outputs" of its other arguments.

      • updateDeterministicLimit

        public int updateDeterministicLimit(int numEdges)
        The maximum number of variable updates beyond which updateDeterministic(com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values.Value[], java.util.Collection<com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values.IndexedValue>, java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference<int[]>) should not be called.

        Default implementation returns 0, indicating that updateDeterministic(com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values.Value[], java.util.Collection<com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values.IndexedValue>, java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference<int[]>) should never be called.

        Parameters:
        numEdges - is the number of edges (variables) to consider. It corresponds to the size of the first argument to updateDeterministic(com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values.Value[], java.util.Collection<com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values.IndexedValue>, java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference<int[]>).
        Since:
        0.05

      • updateDeterministic

        public boolean updateDeterministic(Value[] values,
                          java.util.Collection<IndexedValue> oldValues,
                          java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference<int[]> changedOutputsHolder)
        Deterministically update output values in values array incrementally based on changed input values.

        For functions that support it, this can allow for more efficient computation when there are many inputs and or outputs and only a small subset of inputs have changed (e.g. one when doing a single Gibbs update).

        The default implementation delegates back to evalDeterministic(Value[]), which will do a full update.

        Parameters:
        values - is the array of output and input values that are maintained persistently. When this method is called, it may be assumed that the contents contains the current values of all input variables and the last computed values of all output variables (which were based on previous values of inputs).
        oldValues - contains descriptions of the variable number and old value of each input. Only indexes of input variables should be specified. This list should not contain more than updateDeterministicLimit(int) elements.
        changedOutputsHolder - should be set by the function to contains the list of indexes of output variables that were changed or else set to contain null if all of the outputs were modified.
        Returns:
        true if update was done incrementally (i.e not all inputs were processed), false if full update was done.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if an index in oldValues does not refer to an input variable.

      • createTableForDomains

        protected IFactorTable createTableForDomains(JointDomainIndexer domains)
        Generate a factor table for this function over the given domains.

        Invoked implicitly by getFactorTable(JointDomainIndexer) the first time a factor table is needed for specified domains.

      • getOrDefault

        public static <K,V> V getOrDefault(java.util.Map<K,V> map,
                   K key,
                   V defaultValue)
        Looks up a value or default from a map.

        Returns result from map.get(key) if non-null, otherwise returns defaultValue.

        This can be used to read parameters in FactorFunction constructors that take a parameter map.

        Since:
        0.07
        See Also:
        getFirstOrDefault(Map, Object, Object...)

      • getFirst

        @SafeVarargs
@Nullable
public static <K,V> V getFirst(java.util.Map<K,V> map,
                                    K... keys)
        Looks up a value using multiple keys

        Returns first non-null result from map.get(key} for each key in keys. If none is found, null is returned.

        Since:
        0.07
        See Also:
        getOrDefault(Map, Object, Object)
